文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: Materials tested were: five lots of Zircaloy-2; one lot of Ozhennite (Zr-0.2Sn-0.1Fe-0.1Ni-0.1Nb) and one lot of crystal bar zirconium

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: As-fabricated (rolled or extruded) Zircaloy-2 underwent a rapid approach to failure in tests at 475 and 500 C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: As-fabricated (rolled or extruded) Zircaloy-2 underwent a rapid approach to failure in tests at 475 and 500 C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: Heat treatments (α and β anneals) delayed the catastrophic attack on Zircaloy-2 but not on crystal bar zirconium

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: Kass [5] reported poor corrosion resistance for Zircaloy-2 at 510 C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: Bourgeois and Chirigos [6] reported that alpha-annealed Zircaloy-2 formed a non-adherent white oxide after 1 day at 510 C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: beta-quenched specimens were more resistant, but 0.080-in. thick specimens failed completely between 15 and 21 days

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: Weinstein and Holtz [7] found that Zircaloy-2 disintegrated in steam at 480 C within 97 h

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk1
证据片段: Specimen thicknesses after etching were 0.025 to 0.035 in

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk2
证据片段: specimens ${ \sim } 0 . 0 3 0$ EPY in. thick were essentially penetrated locally in 1 day at $5 0 0 \mathrm { C }$ and in 5 days at $4 7 5 \mathrm { { C } }$

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk2
证据片段: Ozhennite was resistant to the nodular attack

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk2
证据片段: At $4 7 5 \ \mathrm { C }$ ,oxide nodules nucleated after $2 4 \mathrm { h }$ on two of the Zircaloy-2 cladding lots (42-0 and 47-0) and on Zircaloy-2 lot 1021

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk2
证据片段: Specimens of a 2.5Nb zirconium alloy exposed 4 days at $4 7 5 \ \mathrm { C }$ performed similarly to Ozhennite

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk2
证据片段: At $4 5 0 \mathrm { { C } }$ the nodular attack was not observed in exposures to 59 days

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: Kass presented evidence that the failure of Zircaloy-2 in steam at $6 2 5 \mathrm { ~ C ~ }$ was more rapid at 1500 psi than at 15 psi.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: Kass presented evidence that the failure of Zircaloy-2 in steam at $6 2 5 \mathrm { ~ C ~ }$ was more rapid at 1500 psi than at 15 psi.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: Wanklyn et al [13] observed a similar pressure effect on the failure of Van Arkel zirconium at $5 0 0 \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: Klepfer [15] conducted tests in steam at 1000 psi up to $3 5 6 ~ \mathrm { h }$ at $4 8 0 \mathrm { \Omega }$ without observing failure on Zircaloy-2

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: Weinstein and Holtz [7] observed failure in steam after $9 7 \ \mathrm { h }$ at 1500 psi at $4 8 0 \mathrm { \Omega } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: Each material was exposed in alpha $( 7 6 0 \mathrm { C } )$ and beta $( 1 0 1 0 \mathrm { C } )$ annealed (fast-cooled), conditions

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_020_chunk3
证据片段: The specimens were exposed at $5 0 0 \mathrm { \Omega C }$ in steam at 1700 psi.
